data.title: Tennis in Prague: Courts, Shops, and Championships
data.meta_description: Tennis in Prague is a big deal, and for a good reason: the Czech capital has a beautiful and historic setting for the sport, making it ideal for both amateurs
data.text:
Tennis in Prague is a big deal, and for a good reason: the Czech capital has a beautiful and historic setting for the sport, making it ideal for both amateurs and pros. Players of all ages and abilities may enjoy Prague’s thriving tennis scene, which features well-kept courts, top-notch facilities, and a long history of the sport.

A prominent feature of tennis in Prague is the city’s long and storied history of the sport. Many legendary Czech tennis players have come from this country and gone on to dominate the sport worldwide.

In addition, Prague has a rich tennis history and many top-notch tennis facilities for all levels. From public parks with well-maintained courts to exclusive clubs with cutting-edge facilities, tennis enthusiasts have several alternatives for practicing and enjoying the game. These facilities offer instruction, clinics, and tournaments for players to grow, compete, and socialize.

Best Czech tennis players & legends

The country’s numerous accomplished tennis players are among the most popular people in the Czech Republic and have made a lasting impression on the sport and gone on to great worldwide success. Some of the best Czech tennis players and legends are:

Martina Navratilova

Navratilova is considered a tennis legend. Prague-born, she became an American citizen and had a successful career for decades. Navratilova became one of tennis’s most dominant players with 18 Grand Slam singles victories and 31 Grand Slam doubles titles.

Ivan Lendl

Another successful Czech tennis player was Ivan Lendl. Lendl, known for his baseline approach and ferocious intensity, won eight Grand Slam singles titles, including three straight US Open triumphs. He dominated the ATP Tour for 270 weeks as world No. 1.

Petra Kvitova

Winning two Wimbledon singles titles, Kvitova has reached the top of the women’s game with her powerful left-handed game and serve. She has also won numerous titles with the Czech Republic’s Fed Cup team.

Tomas Berdych

He was one of the best Czech tennis players of his generation. With his aggressive approach and strong groundstrokes, Berdych reached the 2010 Wimbledon final and attained a career-high global No. 4. He was instrumental in the 2012 Czech Republic Davis Cup win.

Hana Mandlikova

In the 1980s, Czech tennis player Hana Mandlikova was successful. Australian, French, and US Open championships were among her four Grand Slam singles triumphs. She was a difficult opponent due to Mandlikova’s grace and versatility.

Jana Novotna

The Czech tennis player Jana Novotna was good at serve-and-volley and doubles. She won Wimbledon singles in 1998 and 17 Grand Slam doubles and mixed doubles trophies. Fans worldwide admired Novotna’s perseverance and sportsmanship.

Jan Kodes

Famous Czech tennis player Jan Kodes won in the 1960s and 1970s. He won the French Open and Wimbledon, among three Grand Slam singles titles. Kodes’ mental tenacity and versatility made him a great clay and grass player.

What are the best tennis courts in Prague?

Prague has several top-notch tennis courts where players of all abilities may enjoy the game in scenic locations. Some of the greatest tennis courts in Prague are these:

Tennis Center Olšanská

Location: Chelčického 2614, 130 00 Praha 3-Žižkov, Czechia

I. Czech Lawn Tennis Club

Location: ostrov Štvanice 38, 170 00 Praha 7-Holešovice, Czechia

Tennis and Padel Club Sandy

Location: K Sadu 590/1, 182 00 Praha 8, Czechia

TenisServis

Location: Nad Lávkou 672/5, 160 00 Praha 6, Czechia

Pala Vizner Tennis

Location: Suttnerové 841/2, 160 00 Praha 6-Vokovice, Czechia

Shopping for tennis gear: Top 3 tennis shops in Prague

Is Prague a destination you’re considering for a tennis vacation? If you are looking to improve your tennis game, your search ends at one of the best tennis stores in Prague.

Pk Tenis

The world-famous PK Tenis Prague tennis shop is in the heart of the exciting Czech Republic. Tennis players of all ages and abilities go to PK Tenis Prague for specialized tennis services and to shop for tennis gear.

Go22.cz

Reputable tennis retailer Go22.cz is based in Prague, Czech Republic. To meet the demands of tennis players of all skill levels, Go22.cz is a dedicated tennis shop in Prague that provides a large selection of tennis gear, clothing, and accessories.

Tennis centrum

Tennis Centrum is a Prague-based online tennis store that sells a variety of tennis apparel and equipment. In order to meet the needs of players of all skill levels, they offer a variety of brands and offer simple shipping alternatives.

What is the most prestigious tennis cup in Prague?

Among Prague’s tennis tournaments, the ATP Prague Open is the most esteemed. Every year in Prague, Czech Republic, professional tennis players gather for this event, which is a part of the ATP Challenger Tour. Because of the substantial prize money and ranking points it offers, the Prague Open draws world-class players from all around.

The tournament offers a thrilling stage for players of tennis in Prague to demonstrate their abilities and compete at a high level; it usually takes place on clay courts.
